All eyes are on London tonight as Josh Taylor and Regis Prograis clash in one of the most eagerly-awaited fights of the year.

The super-lightweight world champions put their belts on the line in the final of the World Boxing Super Series at The O2.

The fight is almost too close to call and headlines an exciting night of action with Dereck Chisora and David Price also clashing in an intriguing heavyweight contest.

There is also world title action across the Atlantic as Shakur Stevenson bids to win the vacant WBO featherweight belt when he takes Joet Gonzalez.

Here is everything you need to know about tonight's fights...

Josh Taylor vs Regis Prograis

What time is the fight?

The fight is due to start between 10.30pm and 11pm.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

What TV channel is it on?

The fight will be broadcast on Sky Sports Box Office at a cost of £19.95. The programme starts from 7pm with the first half hour also available to watch on Sky Sports Action.

Order the fight by clicking here .

Is there a live stream?

The fight can be streamed via the Sky Sports website for the same cost.
